result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley G Pellmann Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to any other sentence currently serving.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Credit to be submitted by stipulation.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. To be taken from prison funds.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent in writing & functioning IID.   Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with the family members of NT unless initiated by them and approved by DOC. Not use, consume or possess alcohol. No alcohol in residence where def resides.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. Sobrietor for 6 mo upon release.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom;  Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Copy given defendant, reading waived.
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom;  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Preliminary hearing on August 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any member of the family of Nathan T.
  - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $30,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $50,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 5
